metadata.Title: CVE-2018-20023 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
LibVNC before 8b06f835e259652b0ff026898014fc7297ade858 contains CWE-665:Improper Initialization vulnerability in VNC Repeater client code thatallows attacker to read stack memory and can be abuse for informationdisclosure. Combined with another vulnerability, it can be used to leakstack memory layout and in bypassing ASLR

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20023` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvncclient1 - 0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
libvncserver-config - 0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
libvncserver1 - 0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

italc-client - 1:3.0.3+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1
italc-management-console - 1:3.0.3+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1
italc-master - 1:3.0.3+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1
libitalccore - 1:3.0.3+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvncserver package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1').
italc package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:3.0.3+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1').
